item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Rob Sheffield
item.description: "I'd shut the whole world down just to tell you" -- Rob Sheffield

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Daniel Handler
item.description: "This is love, to sit with someone you've known forever in a place you've been meaning to go, and watching as their life happens to them until you stand up and it's time to go." -- Daniel Handler

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Daniel Handler
item.description: "How do you forget something? You just walk away from it, those who are still alive. There are so few clearings in our hearts and minds, so few places where something can't grow on top of whatever happened to us before, and this is love too. " -- Daniel Handler

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Daniel Handler
item.description: "Love was in the air, so both of us walked through love on our way to the corner." -- Daniel Handler

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Daniel Handler
item.description: "Everybody has a theory." -- Daniel Handler

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Daniel Handler
item.description: "Love can smack you like a seagull, and pour all over your feet like junk mail." -- Daniel Handler

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "Live the dream, Potato." -- Miranda July

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "The idea that you might end up in a job that doesn't allow you to be who you are, over the course of a lifetime, is still one of the most chilling nightmares to me. It's a good metaphor for fears I have about losing my soul in some accidental, mundane way. So, to me, these jobs that my characters have are very loaded. They immediately suggest a complex character to me, a woman who is, say, a secretary, but also a vigilante on behalf of her own soul." -- Miranda July

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "People tend to stick to their own size group because it's easier on the neck. Unless they are romantically involved, in which case the size difference is sexy. It means: I am willing to go the distance for you." -- Miranda July

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "He seemed to be waiting for me to move forward. Weren't we all." -- Miranda July

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "But, like ivy, we grow where there is room for us." -- Miranda July

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Heather O'Neill
item.description: "Love is a big and wonderful idea, but life is made up of small things. As a kid, you have nothing to do with the way the world is run; you just have to hurry to catch up with it." -- Heather O'Neill

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Heather O'Neill
item.description: "Lonely children probably wrote the Bible." -- Heather O'Neill

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Heather O'Neill
item.description: "The stars are always up in the sky...then when it is perfectly black, they feel less vulnerable and out they come." -- Heather O'Neill

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Joshua Knelman
item.description: "I've taken to crossing my fingers in order to simulate your presence." -- Joshua Knelman

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Joshua Knelman
item.description: "Venice is a quantum city, a Schroedinger's cat of a map." -- Joshua Knelman

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Joshua Knelman
item.description: "We shone flashlights through our fingers to convince ourselves that we're made of blood." -- Joshua Knelman

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "We accept the love we think we deserve." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "And in that moment, I swear we were infinite." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "So, this is my life. And I want you to know that I am both happy and sad and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "I think that if I ever have kids, and they are upset, I won't tell them that people are starving in China or anything like that because it wouldn't change the fact that they were upset. And even if somebody else has it much worse, that doesn't really change the fact that you have what you have." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "I would die for you. But I won't live for you." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "I walked over to the hill where we used to go and sled. There were a lot of little kids there. I watched them flying. Doing jumps and having races. And I thought that all those little kids are going to grow up someday. And all of those little kids are going to do the things that we do. And they will all kiss someone someday. But for now, sledding is enough. I think it would be great if sledding were always enough, but it isn't." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "The inside jokes weren't jokes anymore. They had become stories. Nobody brought up the bad names or the bad times. And nobody felt sad as long as we could postpone tomorrow with more nostalgia. " -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Have you felt it too? Have you seen how your best friends love everything about you- except the things that count? And your most important is nothing to them; nothing, not even a sound they can recognize." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Art is a selective re-creation of reality according to an artists metaphysical value judgments." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "There’s nothing as significant as a human face. Nor as eloquent. We can never really know another person, except by our first glance at him. Because, in that glance, we know everything. Even though we’re not always wise enough to unravel the knowledge." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "I would give the greatest sunset in the world for one sight of New York's skyline. Particularly when one can't see the details. Just the shapes. The shapes and the thought that made them. The sky over New York and the will of man made visible. What other religion do we need? And then people tell me about pilgrimages to some dank pesthole in a jungle where they go to do homage to a crumbling temple, to a leering stone monster with a pot belly, created by some leprous savage. Is it beauty and genius they want to see? Do they seek a sense of the sublime? Let them come to New York, stand on the shore of the Hudson, look and kneel. When I see the city from my window - no, I don't feel how small I am - but I feel that if a war came to threaten this, I would throw myself into space, over the city, and protect these buildings with my body." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "But a few understand that building is a great symbol we live in our minds, and existence is the attempt to bring that life into physical reality, to state it in gesture and form. For the man who understands this, a house he owns is a statement of his life." -- Ayn Rand
